Key Match Events: The Rockets found their groove in the second quarter, narrowing the gap with a 10-0 run capped by a Thompson dunk.
In that decisive frame, the Rockets posted 40 points, fueled by Green and Şengün’s combined brilliance, shooting 15 of 23.
The Rockets turned 18 Washington turnovers into 35 points, extending their lead to as much as 26.
Post-Match Reflections: The Rockets, now boasting 24 wins, remain a dominant force in the Western Conference.
The Wizards, struggling at the bottom of the Eastern Conference with a 6-28 record, could not maintain their momentum.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rockets overcame a sluggish start, trailing 28-16 after a cold-shooting first quarter where they hit just 29.2% of their attempts.
The Wizards lost Kyle Kuzma to a calf injury in the first half, further stifling their chances.
Others: Alperen Şengün shined with 26 points, 10 rebounds, six assists and two steals.
Jalen Green erupted for 22 of his game-high 29 points in a pivotal third quarter.
Amen Thompson added a monstrous 20 points and 15 rebounds.
